An excellent game - beautiful in story and graphics. Columbia an interesting change from the good ole city of Rapture. Overall not a bad game, but not even comparable to its predecessors.

excellent graphics
excellent story line
good character stories
Cons:
too many controls
can only hold 2 weapons at a time and VERY limited ammo
(personal preference): a big let-down - I expected a lot more from the 3rd Bioshock game overall

Bioshock Infinite is a fine game overall, but more of a linear shooter than a proper, open-ended and explorable world like Bioshock and System Shock 2. Backtracking is impossible, which puts the player's desire to explore at odds with his/her urge to advance the story. Still, the story is above-average, the world is meticulously designed, the music is incredible, and the game features at least two compelling characters (neither of whom get quite as much development as you'd hope, unfortunately), which makes it more worth playing than any other linear FPS in recent memory.
best fps game
Beautiful and challenging.

In short, recomend this game, SO MUCH YES! <3

In my opinion, this is the best game of the trilogy. Even though it's not set in the wonderful underwater city of Rapture, Columbia is just as breathtaking. It shows that just because things look fine and dandy on the outside, darkness and evil still lingers. It shows the darkside of religion and war. Booker and Elizabeth are both fabulous characters, and for me, a definitely replay. 

Even though there's controversy around the overall theme and plot that really brings things together in the universe(s), it's a concept that'll keep you thinking and going back to.

BioShock Infinate is a reat game anyone who likes first person shooters or a great story should pick up. this is the only bioshock game ive palyed and its convinvinced me to get the original bioshock game. personaly i just all around loved the game it allowed everyone to have there own stratagy to play the game with diffrening weapons and vigors used together i went through most the game with the murder of crows vigor using the sniper rifle and carbine my stratagy envolved using murder of crows on someone then shooting them with the sniper. with gameplay like that aswell as the graphic in the game being its own art style made it alot of fun to play. though if you play the game make sure to pay attention to the story the games story is so interesting and it will end with you wanting more. you might even play throuh the game a few more times to figure out exactly what happend

I was very unhappily disappointed to find that this game, although a decent idea, did not fully earn the right to have the name Bioshock as the other two games were fantastic and the sense of creepiness was a nice touch. In this game, nothing was ever creepy or unexpected. Nothing jumped at you from around a corner, or mumbled to themselves about how everything turned out wrong. The tone in this game is just completely different from the other two Bioshock games. They literally changed every aspect of the games. There is no history in this game that leads back to those games expect in the last few scenes where you "revisit" Rapture for about 2 minutes where there is no Plasmids, no combat, and no story. It's just a place to go to watch Songbird die. Bioshock Infinite should have included some aspect of Rapture. Setting a similar game in the past of an amazing game was just generally a bad idea because it didn't even try to include anything relating to the other 2 Bioshock games. Sure, the gameplay is okay, but eventually you just start wondering, "How the fuck is this a Bioshock game? It doesn't even relate to Bioshock or Bioshock 2!". And there is no freedom of movement throughout the game. There is no extra routes you can take. It seriously gives you one path to walk. It's like throwing you on a road with just an arrow pointing straight ahead. There are no cross-sections, no intersections. You do what they say and you get no other choice. Completing the game once is enough to make you never want to do that again because there in nothing you could ever miss. It hands everything to you.
Love this game! It gives clean mechanics as well as contributes a nice diversity to the BIoshock games in terms of the setting.
Great game!
Geile Story und zudem ein leicht zugänglicher Shooter, wer Wert auf eine schwer verstehbare, verschachtelte Story legt ist hier genau richtig
Big turnaround after Bioshock II. This game will remind you why videogames can be considered art.

Yes, I do recommend the game, but not at full price.

Obviously, the media and "professional reviewers" hyped this game up waaay too much. It's not a revolutionary game but it's not bad by any means. In fact it's one of the better games I've played this year, though that doesn't really say much.

It's very appearent though that this game focuses more on it's story than the previous Bioshock installments. And while the story in this game is probably the best one out of all the Bioshock games, the gameplay sort of suffered from it. Lot's of working gameplay features have been removed. 
Infinite isn't a Shooter with RPG elements like the previous installments, it's just a plain shooter. This design choice seems rather odd to me, as none of the Bioshock games have been known for "tremendous gunplay". It works, but gets really bland after a while, and the plasmids (or in this game "vigors") don't really help too much. I've ended up using like 2 of them as most of them pretty much do the same thing, that being stun + damage, the only difference being that certain enemy types are not affected by certain vigors.

So when it comes down to it, Infinite is a more or less 12 hour movie with barely above decent shooting inbetween the rather nice story sections.

If you want to look into it, I'd definitly wait for it to go on sale, which is what I did. I payed 10 bucks and got a pretty good game for that price, but would have probably felt ripped off if I payed full price, since it doesn't offer near as much content gameplay-wise as the previous Bioshocks did.
Awesome game. Amazing ending!

At first, I was wary of this game. Bioshock without Rapture? A city in the skies with equal technology years before the discovery of ADAM?
But, Infinite isn't just a spin-off as I believed. The story is amazing and beautiful. If it looks confusing, just press your brain a little, because everything makes sense at the end. 

About the fighting, I heard some people complaining about the shooting being boring or something. I don't have quarrels about that. I'm happy enough electrocuting people until their heads explode.

There's a lot to like here, but it fails to live up to its potential.  Columbia is another great setting like Rapture.  The combat is good, though limiting the player to two weapons at a time feels likes a crappy concession to console players, and is a step in the wrong direction.  The powers are fun though again not quite as good as Bioshock.  The story starts out good but by the end becomes a convoluted mess and ultimately ends horribly.  They tried too hard to make it complex with unexpected twists.  Ultimately I had a lot of fun playing this game and can recommend it, but don't expect it to be on par with Bioshock 1 or 2
Stunning graphics, amazing story and good gameplay.

Очередной шедевр Кена Левина.

Радует переход от Рэтро-Футуризма и Нуара к Стимпанку (паропанку), город в небе это что-то новое, еще когда вышел первый трейлер относился скептически, потом вышла демка и очень понравилось, ждал ее 3 чертовых года, очень странно что ей присвоили звание "шутер года" я не воспринимаю игру как шутер, жаль конечно ей не присвоили звание игра года, но зато Лютесы персонажи года, наверное должна была стать Элизабет видел ее многие полюбили, Лютесы напомнили Г-мана из Халфы, музыка как всегда отлично подходит, по радио и фонографу слышал музыку но жаль не могу найти, узнать бы название, может кто нибудь и выложит, на гемплей они видно не сильно тратили время, но это и не важно она все таки как ни странно "шутер года", плазмиды в первой части смотрелись более оригинально чем тут, не шприцом (EVE) колоться а просто выпить бутылку с солями, даже не всегда ими пользовался но бывали моменты где и правда нужны, все так же интересно использовать/экспериментировать на противниках.

[Спойлеры] Как я понял сюжет, хотя тут скорее предыстория но все равно тем кто не прошел игру лучше не читать -

Постараюсь коротко, 1891г Букер ДеВитт раскаивается за грехи, принимает крещение и рождается вновь называя себя Закари Комстоком, знакомится с одним из Лютесов (в одной вселенной с Робертом а в другой с Розалиндой) убеждает правительство США финансировать строительство летающего города Колумбии.. город построен, это гордость США и показывает миру ее превосходство. 
1901г - восстание в Пекине, Колумбия атакует китайцев обосновывая тем, что они держат в плену мирных американских граждан и показывая миру насколько она вооружена, правительство посылает Комстока в отставку, в итоге Колумбия отделяется от Соединенных Штатов и пропадает где-то в облаках. о ней не слуху не духу.. 
А в это время в небесах: Леди Комсток не может родить наследницу Колумбии и Комсток обращается к Лютесам, с помощью своей машины они находят Букера ДеВитта из другой реальности который не принял крещение, есть дочь Анна, и куча долгов, Букер продает дочь и теперь долги погашены, Букер в последний момент передумал и пытается спасти в итоге Анна она же в будущем Элизабет остается без пальца и Букер наказывает себя клеймом на руке "АД" - Анна ДеВитт. В городе все думают что это их рожденная дочь, Леди Комсток не признает ее и не хочет скрывать правду, Комсток убивает ее и скидывает все на Дейзи Фицрой (лидер "Глаза народа") Лютесов тоже решает убрать, наверное слишком много знают.. но они избегают смерти и теперь могут появляться везде где только захотят, в любом времени и пространстве как Г-ман загадочный персонаж из Халфы (я не совсем понял как они так умеют, скорее побочный эффект от их машины открывающий разрывы(порталы) в другие вселенные) Лютесы знают какие планы у Комстока и решают ему помешать, зовут Букера ДеВитта из той вселенной где он не принял крещение, не стал Комстоком, где нет Колумбии.

Will definately be investing in some DLC when the rest of it comes.
For the moment I will continue to die repeatedly until I can complete 1999 mode :)

Das Spiel bietet wieder mal eine ganz interessante Geschichte, die aber etwas spät zündet. Zwar ist der Anfang sehr beeindruckend gemacht, doch dann beginnt eine Such und Ballerorgie, die eher Mau ist. Am Ende greift dann ein wenig die Story ins Spielgeschehen, was das Spiel im ganzen wieder interessanter macht. 
Die Idee mit der Begleiterin, die einem immer mit kleinen nützlichen Helferlein beliefert ist gut gemacht. 
Die Gruselatmosphäre und die bedrückende Stimmung bisheriger "Shock" Teile bleibt aber weitgehenst aus. Lediglich die Irrenanstalt ist etwas düster und gruselig. 
Alles in allem bleibt das Spiel trotz sehr interessantem Setting und atemberaubender Grafik spielerisch doch eher mau und so ist man nach ca. 16 Stunden Spielzeit auch irgendwie froh, das man es hinter sich hat..
